page.title: 07Farming
page.content: Many of the farms in the area have long histories, dating back to 16th century and before.{Wraysholme Farm}is one of the older farms and part of the outbuildings is a{Peel Tower,}built in the 12th century as protection against raiders from across the Irish Sea. Generally farms in the area keep livestock,Dairy and Beef cattle and some farms have flocks of sheep. There is plentiful grazing either on native grass,resown improved grassland,areas reclaimed from the marshes and even the salt marsh itself. Many farms supply milk for local needs, some have farm shops selling to the public.All are modern in their methods and equipment. Farmers are well-known and respected members of the community,often serving on local councils,as school governors and on committees.
